item.title: Few reasons for optimism after Antony Blinken's diplomatic dash
item.description: Over three frantic days, Antony Blinken tried to find middle ground where none exists, for now.

item.title: NHS pay: Health staff win Covid bonus after legal action threat
item.description: Thousands of health workers who were excluded from a bonus will now get the payment, ministers say.

item.title: Annual oil and gas licences planned with net zero commitment required
item.description: Projects will have to meet net zero targets, under the proposals to be outlined in the King's Speech.

item.title: Police petrol bombed in Edinburgh Bonfire Night disorder
item.description: About 100 young people threw firebombs and fireworks at riot police in Edinburgh.

item.title: Liverpool's Díaz begs father's kidnappers to free him
item.description: Colombian-born Liverpool footballer Luis Díaz begs for his father's kidnappers to free him immediately.

item.title: Our Future Health: One million sign up to help change healthcare
item.description: Largest UK medical research project will be used to change the way diseases are tackled.

item.title: Labour: Burnley councillors quit party over Israel-Gaza ceasefire stance
item.description: The leader of Burnley Council and 10 other councillors have resigned from the party.

item.title: Rail line project axed by Welsh government
item.description: Public money has been lost on the project, which would have improved travel to major Cardiff events.

item.title: Ukraine war: Military chiefs in Kyiv under pressure over deadly Russian strike
item.description: President Zelensky demands answers after Russia hits Ukrainian soldiers said to be at an award ceremony.

item.title: Queues for bottled water as thousands lose supply
item.description: Technical issues are blamed as thousands have been without water since Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Verstappen wins from Norris at Sao Paulo Grand Prix
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes a controlled victory in the Sao Paulo Grand Prix to extend his record for wins in a season to 17.

item.title: Britain's loneliest sheep in hiding after rehoming row
item.description: Animal rights activists protest at a farm park which was planning to look after the rescued ewe.

item.title: The Papers: Met pressure over demos and Gaza strikes intensify
item.description: Protests over fighting in Gaza and calls to ban them over Remembrance weekend lead many papers.

item.title: The US is quietly arming Taiwan to the teeth
item.description: America is using its own money to send weapons to a place it officially doesn't recognise.

item.title: Barbra Streisand: I haven't had much fun in my life
item.description: One of Hollywood's biggest stars takes a reflective look at her life, as she publishes her memoir.

item.title: 'My life stopped when my brother killed our dad'
item.description: Karen Cooper, whose brother killed their father, wants more support for people bereaved by homicide.

item.title: Football Manager 2024: How the franchise made millions
item.description: As the studio celebrates its 20th edition, the people that make it tell the BBC how it has changed.

item.title: British Gaza evacuees have three days to leave Egypt
item.description: The deadline means people with non-British family who need to apply for UK visas risk overstaying.

item.title: How does your pay compare with other jobs?
item.description: Use our interactive lookup tool to find out how pay has changed in your job.

item.title: Musk says his new AI chatbot has 'a little humour'
item.description: The AI tool, designed to have a cheeky tone to its writing, is not yet widely available.

item.title: One in 10 mothers with under-fours quit work over childcare, says charity
item.description: A quarter of a million mothers with children under four have left their jobs, the Fawcett Society says.

item.title: Four surprises that could upend the 2024 US election
item.description: A year ahead of the US presidential election, and anything could happen.

item.title: Zaghari-Ratcliffe: More action needed over jailed Scot
item.description: The freed British Iranian national says the UK should call for the release of Jagtar Singh Johal from jail in India.

item.title: Met Police cuts ties with adviser Attiq Malik after chant video emerges
item.description: Attiq Malik was recorded in 2021 ending a speech with the chant "from the river to the sea".

item.title: Refund calls as smoke 'blocks' Edgbaston fireworks display
item.description: Videos show thick plumes of smoke blocking the view with the stadium saying it is investigating.

item.title: CBeebies' Rebecca Keatley to see other side of screen with baby due
item.description: Rebecca Keatley is seeing her work in a new light as she prepares to become a parent this winter.

item.title: Center Parcs Woburn Forest: Teen dies after skateboard fall
item.description: The company says it has been a "distressing time" and its thoughts are with the boy's family.

item.title: Deputy PM Oliver Dowden denies cover-up over MP rape allegations
item.description: It follows reports an ex-Conservative chairman wrote to police with concerns over handling of complaints.

item.title: Luton Town 1-1 Liverpool: Luis Diaz ends emotional week with late Liverpool equaliser
item.description: Luis Diaz comes off the bench to salvage a point for Liverpool with a stoppage-time goal at Luton in his first match since his parents were kidnapped.

item.title: Cricket World Cup 2023: Virat Kohli is the one-day king and the king for one day
item.description: In Kolkata, the City of Joy, the whole of India celebrated Virat Kohli's birthday, his record-equalling one-day hundred and another stop on their march towards glory.

item.title: Arsenal 2-1 Manchester City: Jonas Eidevall accused of 'bullying' fourth official by Gareth Taylor
item.description: Manchester City manager Gareth Taylor accuses Arsenal boss Jonas Eidevall of "bullying" the fourth official during their WSL match on Sunday.

item.title: Heart of Midlothian 1-3 Rangers: James Tavernier & Scott Wright send Ibrox side into Viaplay Cup final
item.description: Captain James Tavernier scores twice as Rangers eased past Hearts to book a Viaplay Cup final date against Aberdeen on 17 December.

item.title: Charlton Athletic 1-1 Cray Valley Paper Mills: Non-league side defy five-division gap to earn FA Cup first round replay
item.description: Cray Valley Paper Mills bridge a 117-place gap to earn a replay at League One side Charlton Athletic in the first round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Brighton 2-2 Manchester United: Rachel Williams' injury-time goal earns Man Utd point at Brighton
item.description: Rachel Williams scores a dramatic stoppage-time equaliser to earn Manchester United a point against Brighton in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Paris Masters: Novak Djokovic beats Grigor Dimitrov to win 40th Masters title
item.description: Novak Djokovic wins a record-extending seventh Paris Masters trophy and 40th Masters title in total with a 6-4 6-3 victory over Grigor Dimitrov.

item.title: Israel-Gaza war: At least 45 killed at Al-Maghazi refugee camp
item.description: The Hamas-run health ministry says at least 45 people died in what it says was an Israeli air strike.

item.title: Rafah crossing: More than 100 Britons leave Gaza but dozens remain
item.description: The Rafah crossing remains shut after a brief reopening to allow foreign nationals and injured out.

item.title: Bowen: Five new realities after four weeks of Israel-Gaza war
item.description: There are few known quantities in the conflict but some things have become clear, says Jeremy Bowen.

item.title: Hamas hostages: Who are the people taken from Israel?
item.description: From elderly grandparents to young children, these are the people known to have been taken captive.

item.title: Humza Yousaf's in-laws who were trapped in Gaza arrive back in Scotland
item.description: The family of Scotland's first minister is reunited after his wife's parents spent weeks trapped in Gaza.

item.title: Doctor, bride-to-be, and child: Stories of those killed in Gaza
item.description: From surgeons to young children, these are some of the people known to have been killed in Gaza.

item.title: Pentagon acknowledges flying unarmed drones over Gaza
item.description: The US military said the drones, first spotted by journalists, were searching for hostages.

item.title: Hezbollah steps back from all-out war on Israel over Gaza - for now
item.description: The group's leader denied prior knowledge of Hamas's attacks in Israel and left out the possibility of joining the war.

item.title: Israel says Hamas stages hit-and-run attacks from tunnels
item.description: Israel says its troops have encircled Gaza City and is facing Hamas fighters emerging from tunnels.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... Calls for a ceasefire in Gaza
item.description: The BBC's analysis editor examines calls for a ceasefire or humanitarian pause between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.

item.title: Gaza reporter removes protective vest after learning of colleague's death
item.description: A journalist working for Palestine TV was killed in a strike on Gaza, his network said.

item.title: What is Hezbollah in Lebanon and will it go to war with Israel?
item.description: Hassan Nasrallah, the leader of Hezbollah, has praised the Hamas attacks on Israel.

item.title: Gaza mother: 'I'm not able to hug my children'
item.description: Amani left her family in Gaza to study in the UK just days before the war broke out. Now she watches anxiously.

item.title: When they called their mother, Hamas answered the phone
item.description: Ditza Heiman, 84, is being held in Gaza and her daughter wants Israel to find a diplomatic solution.

item.title: Interest rates: How the Bank of England's decision affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England has held interest rates at 5.25%, but borrowing costs remain comparatively high.

item.title: When should I turn the heating on?
item.description: As it gets colder here are some tips to help you stay warm while trying to keep your energy bills down.

item.title: Debt: What should I pay first and what can I do?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: What is GDP and how is it measured?
item.description: A basic guide to how the economy is measured and why that calculation matters.
